1.text: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck Shall suddenly be broken, and that without remedy.

2.text: When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice; But when the wicked beareth rule, the people sigh.

3.text: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father; But he that keepeth company with harlots wasteth his substance.

4.text: The king by justice establisheth the land; But he that exacteth gifts overthroweth it.

5.text: A man that flattereth his neighbour Spreadeth a net for his steps.

6.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare; But the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

7.text: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor; The wicked understandeth not knowledge.

8.text: Scornful men set a city in a blaze; But wise men turn away wrath.

9.text: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, Whether he be angry or laugh, there will be no rest.

10.text: The men of blood hate him that is sincere; And as for the upright, they seek his life.

11.text: A fool spendeth all his spirit; But a wise man stilleth it within him.

12.text: If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood, All his servants are wicked.

13.text: The poor man and the oppressor meet together; The LORD giveth light to the eyes of them both.

14.text: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, His throne shall be established for ever.

15.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom; But a child left to himself causeth shame to his mother.

16.text: When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth; But the righteous shall gaze upon their fall.

17.text: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest; Yea, he will give delight unto thy soul.

18.text: Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint; But he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

19.text: A servant will not be corrected by words; For though he understand, there will be no response.

20.text: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? There is more hope for a fool than for him.

21.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child Shall have him become master at the last.

22.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, And a wrathful man aboundeth in transgression.

23.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low; But he that is of a lowly spirit shall attain to honour.

24.text: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: He heareth the adjuration and uttereth nothing.

25.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare; But whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be set up on high.

26.text: Many seek the ruler’s favour; But a man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.

27.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous; And he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
